snippet: Community colleges have to do a better job of screening the part-time instructors they hire, because they far outnumber full-time faculty members.
abstract: Editorial warns quality of education at community colleges is suffering, given that part-time faculty members far outnumber full-time members on most community college campuses; notes part-timers, often abysmally paid, generally have little time to prepare lessons and are rarely given any guidance; urges community colleges to do a better job of screening the part-time instructors they hire.
lead_paragraph: Community colleges have to do a better job of screening the part-time instructors they hire, because they far outnumber full-time faculty members.
